TopicTitle: Is it just me, or is the control scheme on the PS4 just awful?

Articles.Content:
I am predominantly a console player, and I have been eagerly waiting many months for KSP to arrive on the PS4.  I purchased it on the release date and have played for a couple of hours each night since.

I have to say I am extremely disappointed and frustrated, to the point where I don't even want the game anymore.  The control scheme is awful and unworkable.  I don't know what I should have expected, but based on my experiences so far, I don't think this game can be played with a joystick.  If I could get a refund for my purchase I would certainly take it.  I don't think I have ever played a game on my PS4 with more frustrating controls.

Are frustrating controls just part of this game? I spend minutes struggling to get a component to attach in the location and manner that I desire.  Am I alone in this?

The PC controls utilize almost every button on the computer's keyboard, plust some mod+key combinations.   Trying to cram all that onto a 9-button (or however many) controller is bound to be complex at best.
I find the controls very cumbersome, but am still playing just fine, and am having no problem attaching parts. Press L1 or R1 for slowed more precise control.

The bad control scheme is one of the main things people don't like about the PS4 version, at least from what I've seen on these forums.

The fact it doesn't allow custom configurations and that the default scheme is pretty complex might make Squad and FT react and do something about it.

Though, as @klesh said, you're using pretty much all of a keyboard's keys on PC, so you're not going to end up with a complete and simple layout on PS4. That is, unless you plug in a keyboard and a mouse; but in the porting process, the ability to play the game with its native input hardware was lost somewhere, so you can't actually play KSP on PS4 with anything else than the DS3/4 controller (haven't checked for myself, just reporting). Then again, there is hope this will be fixed.

Edited July 16, 2016 by Gaarst

Just bought this game and was excited to try it. I only play console games, no PC. The controls on the PS4 are terrible. I closed the game after a few minutes of attempting to play it.

I hope they improve this, but I don't know how they can. This seems like a game that should not have been ported to console. Or at least it should have been redesigned and optimized for console gameplay.

The game looks like a lot of fun, and I've heard good things. I've no doubt that it's a joy to play on PC. But this just does not work well on console.

If there is a way to get a refund I would like one please.

Edited July 16, 2016 by jdub

8 hours ago, jdub said:

This seems like a game that should not have been ported to console.

This.

I'm on Xbox, not PS4, but it is equally bad.

I understand that the game uses most of the keyboard worth of controls on the PC and there is no way that is all getting mapped to a controller. I'm totally cool with clicking the left stick to switch between a mouse pointer and other controls. But having to us the mouse pointer to accept/cancel a menu window instead of the console standard A/B (or whatever it is on dualshock) is just plain lazy.

Me and my kids are really enjoying the game and plan to stick with it through the growing pains, but if I were Squad I would be very, very upset at the quality of the console port.

I agree. I used to love playing KSP for linux and MacOS and I just recently purchased KSP for PS4 and it is completely unplayable.

I'm playing on PS4. Controls are not easy to master, but after some time you'll get used to them.

That being said, I do hope that some inconsistencies will be corrected in the future. For example, the zoom is L1+joystick in some modes, but L2/R2 in some others. I get it wrong every time.

I find the control scheme relatively brilliant. I’ve never played a console game with so many controls. Once you get used to it, it’s better than mouse and keyboard. Except for precision stuff in the VAB like aligning wings end to end. Been to every planet and moon in the game at least once. Stick with it, and it gets easier. Learn to use the wheels for shortcuts.

I’m an interaction designer, working as a product lead, and unfortunately this is a poor excuse of a port that would’ve been labeled as a showstopper by any designer with half a brain. It’s not so much about complexity (the sheer amount of inputs) but the total lack of consistency and poor design.

I love KSP, but I’m not even bothering with these controls... it’s back to the iMac for me. Such a shame.
